page.title: 04Ayston Footpath,1,Rutland
page.content: The footpath to Ayston from the Leicester Rd Uppingham is a distinct footpath,which produces quite a contrast to the Castle Hill path.The footpath is clearly signposted from either side and follows a well marked path most of its course.It passes through two unused rough pasture fields,but the path can easily be followed and is not hidden by vegetation because of extensive use.The track passes through local allotments as well as other pasture land,which is used mainly for cattle.Since the by-pass was built the path crosses it (the only manmade hinderence) but stiles have been erected to facilitate access to the path.
